tweet: My mom Shirley Goldman lived in LTC for 3 years until she died in 2014. It would have broken my heart to not be able to visit her on #MothersDay and any other day. I'm thinking of all the families who can't visit today because of #COVID19.

Today marks the 3rd anniversary of SegWit activation on Litecoin. SegWit usage has reached 70%.  For those that weren't around for the SegWit craziness in 2017, check out @theliteschool's great write up on the significance of SegWit activation on Litecoin:  https://t.co/6vNaucekMk  https://t.co/u6wwN1TMW6

We know how lonely it is for seniors w families unable to visit.  COVID-19 has a great impact on senior citizens & the best way to protect yourself is to minimize contact w others.  We continue to work on ways for families to connect safely w loved ones in LTC & assisted living.
“You don’t lock out family. You don’t turn away caregivers when they’re so badly needed” -  @Priorhockey  https://t.co/rpMnpkVuoa via @globeandmail #COVID19 #LTC

It is 60% in Massachusetts.  60% of our deaths are from nursing homes or similar😢  We must protect our nursing homes and other LTC facilities.  We must change the rules.  Decrease room sharing.  Prohibit staff from working at multiple facilities (but still pay them living wages)
